result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Ryan Malott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management and Domestic Abuse. AODA/treatment per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Joshua Ryan Malott in court with attorney Blake Duren.  Defendant Joshua Ryan Malott in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Revocation and summary reviewed by all parties.  Ready to proceed today.  State gives recommendation.  4 months Sauk County Jail on each THC and Bail Jumping, concurrent but consec to 14CF203.  Attorney Duren argues sentencing.  Request time served.  Court agrees with recommendation of State.  Court imposes:
Count 1 & 4:
4 months Sauk County Jail on each count with Huber privileges.  Concurrent to each other, however consecutive to 14CF203.  Forthwith.  60 days credit.  Transfer to Dane County approved, per jail rules.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua Ryan Malott in court with attorney Blake J. Duren.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

2 years Probation
30 days SCJ, w/work release.  Comm. on or before Oct. 1, 2014 @ 6 PM
7 days credit if probation revoked.

Defendant Joshua Ryan Malott appeared by video means with Attorney Woodard along with student intern Steve Hughes. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State request $1000.00 cash bond.  Criminal history noted.  Intern Hughes argues less cash bond.  Explanation for warrant.  Resides locally.  No flight risk.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived. $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  May not oper MV w/out a valid DL.
